snippet: Youth advocates and judges say more children are being sent into the criminal justice system for acts like scuffles and truancy that are better handled in the principal’s office.
abstract: Youth advocates say more children are being sent into the criminal justice system for acts like scuffles and truancy that are better handled in the principal’s office; as school districts across country consider placing more police officers in schools, hundreds of thousands of students are arrested or given criminal citations each year; still, effectiveness of using police to deter crime or remote threat of armed intruders is unclear.
lead_paragraph: Youth advocates and judges say more children are being sent into the criminal justice system for acts like scuffles and truancy that are better handled in the principal’s office.
